title: Representations - Average Value of a Function

content.question: Let <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a continuous function that satisfies the condition <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator b minus a, end fraction, times the integral from a, to b, of, f of x, d x, equals f of c" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>⁢</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> for exactly one value of <math alttext="c" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>c</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="a, is less than c, which is less than b" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>a</mi><mo><</mo><mi>c</mi><mo><</mo><mi>b</mi></mrow></math>. Which of the graphs above could be the graph of <math alttext="y equals f of x" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
